description:
The Education Ministry announced that it will begin carrying out remedial lessons to compensate for educational losses for Category B basic education students from August 11th to the 31st, 2020. Schools will be opened from Saturday till Thursday each weak. The students covered by this plan will attend the remedial classes at the nearest school to their homes with a B curriculum, with no more than 20 students in each classroom, all of whom will undergo temperature scans along with teachers and staff, noting that teachers and staff must be under 55 years of age and free of chronic diseases.

All schools must be disinfected every day before the students arrive, drinking water and clean facilities must be available.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Number of people on the school premises are limited (e.g. only 50 people allowed on school premises),Types of people on school premises are limited (e.g. no parents) ,Regular cleaning and sanitary procedures applied to classrooms (e.g. classrooms must be aired out after each class) ,Temperature Check
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Local authorities in Kurdistan region announce that state and private schools for first, second, and twelfth graders will close from November 1st to December 1st, 2020, after which there will be a review of health conditions. 

Twelfth graders will have access to online classes until schools reopen. Private and state schools will continue running online classes for students from grade three to eleven.

description: Northeast Syrian authorities are closing the Semalka border crossing with the Kurdistan Region after March 1, 2020. description: As of March 10th, 2020, Syria suspends visits and trips to and from Iraq and Jordan by individuals and groups, including for purposes of religious tourism, for one month.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: "The necessary precautions to ensure Syrians are protected from the arrival of the coronavirus were on the discussion table for government ministers at the cabinet session headed by Imad Khamis on Sunday.    The cabinet stressed the need to monitor the precautionary and preventive measures taken at all ports, land, sea and air crossings, to ensure that no cases of coronavirus occur on Syrian territory. It decided to suspend visits and trips to and from the neighboring countries of Iraq and Jordan by individuals and groups, including for purposes of religious tourism, for one month. It also suspended visits to countries that have declared a state of epidemic for two months, while conducting preventive quarantine for a period of 14 days for those coming from these countries to ensure their safety."    Sources:    (unable to archive)
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 23, 2020, the Syrian Government stepped up procedures for the supposed response to the epidemic by carrying out campaigns to sterilize cities and villages.

description: The Syrian Government decided on a curfew to prevent the movement of citizens between centres of cities and countryside which came into effect on the 31st of March and is set to last until the 16th of April.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The Syrian Interior Ministry extended the curfew among provinces which prevents the commuting of citizens between province centres and all other urban and rural areas at all times excluding those with clearance 
set to last until April 16 to May 2nd. UPDATE: The original travel restriction referred to under the curfew measure by the Syrian government set to last until April 16 has been extended to May 2.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Syrian Government with the curfew still in place until May 2nd has decided to allow citizens to travel among provinces on the 20th and 21st of April after putting medical teams at the entrance of each province. UPDATE: Curfew among provinces is still enforced until May 2 but the government is making an exception and allowing citizens to travel among provinces on the 20th and 21st of April.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of March 20, 2020, Syrian government introduces “voluntary isolation” for all citizens. Failure to comply with procedures will lead to “mandatory isolation” enforcement.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In March 2020, the AANES has ordered curfew restrictions on the general public. All gatherings and events have been ordered cancelled. Health, public order, cleaning workers, pharmacies, sterilization committees, bakeries, markets, fuel tankers and press workers are excluded from the curfew, but need to have a permit released by the Internal Security Forces.

In cities where the controls have been intensified by the Internal Security Forces, citizens will be able to ask for support from the authorities by calling the phone numbers set for mandatory situations.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units (other than provincial or city level units) within one or more countries
target_other: Autonomous Administration of North and East Syria

description:
In March 2020, the AANES has ordered curfew restrictions on the general public. All gatherings and events have been ordered cancelled. Health, public order, cleaning workers, pharmacies, sterilization committees, bakeries, markets, fuel tankers and press workers are excluded from the curfew, but need to have a permit released by the Internal Security Forces.

In cities where the controls have been intensified by the Internal Security Forces, citizens will be able to ask for support from the authorities by calling the phone numbers set for mandatory situations. UPDATE: Local authorities in NES continue to implement curfew restrictions until at least 21 April. A decree released by local authorities stated that fines will be imposed (ranging from SYP 5,000-45,000) for curfew violation.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units (other than provincial or city level units) within one or more countries
target_other: Autonomous Administration of North and East Syria

description: On July 27th, 2020, the Syrian government called on citizens to stay at home for Eid al-Adha holiday from July 30th to August 3rd.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
From November 3rd to November 19th, 2020, the Executive Council of Jazeera Canton imposes a full 14-day lockdown in ‘Derik city and its countryside’ (understood as the whole of Malakiyeh District).

Under this lockdown, schools, places of worship, restaurants, playgrounds and private clinics will be closed, while movements in and out of Derik city will be prohibited (excluding emergency cases and food shipments). Humanitarian actors are exempted from these restrictions. Shops can sell food between 6 am and 1 pm.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units (other than provincial or city level units) within one or more countries
target_other: The Executive Council of Jazira Canton (part of AANES)

description: As of March 21st, 2020, all the churches are closed for worship in Syria. All general prayer services, including liturgies, in all churches are suspended. All funerals to be held in the cemetery churches exclusively (in case there is one other than the parish church) in the presence of the parish priest and the family of the deceased, without accepting condolences. All meetings and activities are suspended such as vigils, excursions, ceremonies, celebrations, exhibitions, competitions and others.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of an annually recurring event
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
